welcomeTitle: Welcome to ABI - Brazilian Immigration Assistance
welcomeMessage: ABI is a project dedicated to offering essential support to immigrants arriving in Brazil. With a welcoming and secure approach, our platform connects you to vital resources to rebuild your life with dignity, guidance, and opportunity.
legalizacaoCardText: Receive free legal guidance on documentation, CPF, visas, regularization, and immigrant rights.
empregoCardText: We connect you with companies that hire immigrants, with or without a degree. Prepare your resume with us.
estudoCardText: Access to scholarships, free courses in Portuguese, IT, Photoshop, video editing, and much more.
apoioPsicologicoCardText: Voluntary sessions with partner psychologists, support groups, and active listening to care for your mental health.
saudeCardText: Referral to public services, vaccination, emergency care, and university clinics.
segurancaPrivacidadeText: Your data is protected. We use state-of-the-art encryption and follow the guidelines of the General Data Protection Law (LGPD). No information will be shared without your authorization.
callToActionText: Register for free and get immediate access to the ABI platform resources.
guiaIntroText:
This guide was created to accompany you in your first steps in Brazil, helping with documentation, housing, employment, education, health, and much more.
The ABI platform offers free support and connectivity with companies, scholarships, psychological support, and guidance in partnership with universities.
guiaEtapa1Text: Start your regularization process with the Federal Police. You can request asylum, temporary or permanent residence. Keep the application protocol, as it guarantees basic rights until final approval.
guiaEtapa2Text: The CPF is necessary to open a bank account, work, or study. Apply in person at Post Offices or online on the Federal Revenue website.
guiaEtapa3Text: After obtaining your CPF, you can open an account in digital banks like Nubank or at physical branches (Caixa, ItaÃº, etc.). This will make it easier to receive salaries or scholarships.
guiaEtapa4Text: Look for affordable options on websites like OLX, Viva Real, and in support groups on social media. We are working with institutions that also offer temporary shelter.
guiaEtapa5Text: You can check partner companies with job openings for immigrants, including those without a diploma. Our platform connects you directly to available opportunities and allows online applications.
guiaEtapa6Text: Immigrants have the right to free basic education. Additionally, you can access our scholarship system, with technical courses, languages (including Portuguese), IT, video editing, and much more. All offered by partner institutions and accessible through the platform.
guiaEtapa7Text: You can be attended by SUS (Unified Health System) for free. On our platform, you can also request basic support in the health system, provided by students from partner medical schools, with supervision. Complex cases will be referred to specialized clinics and hospitals.
guiaEtapa8Text: The emotional impact of migration can be significant. In the Psychological Support module, you can schedule sessions with psychology students from partner colleges. More delicate cases will be monitored and referred to specialized professionals.
guiaEtapa9Text: Collective transport (bus, subway, and train) is available in most cities. Check if your city offers free passes or social fares. Use apps like Moovit to plan your routes.
guiaEtapa10Text: You have the right to health, education, work, and religious freedom. In return, it's important to respect local laws and live in harmony with society. The platform will also offer basic legal support soon.
instituicoesIntroText: Discover institutions, NGOs, and churches that offer essential help to migrants and refugees in Brazil. Find psychological, spiritual, food, social services, and much more.
